person.persName: William A. Hooe (Mercer County, lawyer and state representative)

body.p: Harrodsburg, Kentucky, lawyer and state representative. Married to Nancy McAfee Hooe. Father of Joseph A. Hooe, Mary Hooe, Edward B. Hooe, Robert M. Hooe, William A. Hooe Jr., Emmet M. Hooe, Frank Hooe, Nannie Hooe, and Willie Hooe. Married to Sue Burford Hooe on February 3, 1858. Served in the Kentucky House of Representatives in 1843 and 1849. Lawyer in Mercer County, Kentucky in 1850. Owned three enslaved persons in Mercer County in 1850. Served in the Kentucky state senate from 1851 to 1853. Lawyer in Harrodsburg in 1860. Owned two enslaved persons in Harrodsburg in 1860. Signed a petition on behalf of Samuel Matheney in Mercer County, on November 18, 1861. Signed a petition on behalf of John W. Bingham and Nimrod Harris in Mercer County on November 18, 1861.
